cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with zero knowledge arguments, which are commonly studied in the cryptography (cs.CR) and information theory (cs.IT) communities. The use of linear spaces and codes suggests a connection to coding theory (cs.DS), while the mention of protocols and complexity hints at theoretical computer science (cs.CC). Finally, the use of polynomials and algebraic techniques may also indicate a connection to machine learning (cs.LG).
